title.rendered: Scholarship and Financial Assistance Opportunities in the USA for International Students in 2025

content.rendered:
Are you ready to embark on your academic journey in the USA? Great news! Various scholarships are available for international students wishing to study in the United States. This article will provide a comprehensive overview of the scholarships offered by top U.S. universities, outlining their benefits and the step-by-step application process.

For the academic year 2025-2026, numerous scholarships are accessible at leading U.S. universities. These scholarships include partial and full funding, covering tuition fees, accommodation costs, health insurance, travel allowances, and a monthly stipend.

Take the opportunity to apply for fully funded scholarships and realize your dream of studying at prestigious institutions such as Yale University, Harvard University, Clark University, Boise State University, Berea College, and many others.

Here is a list of scholarships available in the USA for international students:

#1.  Fulbright Scholarships USA

Description: The Fulbright Program is a prestigious international exchange program sponsored by the U.S. government. It offers scholarships for graduate students, young professionals, and artists to study, conduct research, or teach in the United States.

Eligibility:

– Open to graduate students, young professionals, and artists from around the world.

– Applicants should have a strong academic background and a well-defined project or research proposal.

– Specific eligibility criteria and application requirements vary by country.

Benefits:

– Full tuition coverage.

– Monthly stipend for living expenses.

– Health insurance.

– Travel allowance.

Application Process:

  1. Check Eligibility: Review the specific eligibility criteria for your country on the Fulbright website or through your local Fulbright Commission.
  2. Prepare Documents: Gather necessary documents, including academic transcripts, letters of recommendation, and a research or study proposal.
  3. Submit Application: Apply through the Fulbright Commission or U.S. Embassy in your home country.
  4. Interviews and Selection: Participate in interviews or assessments if required.
  5. Receive Award: If selected, you will receive guidance on visa applications and other preparatory steps.

#2. Stanford University Scholarships

The Stanford University Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded opportunity for international students pursuing Master’s and Ph.D. programs at Stanford. This scholarship provides comprehensive financial support to help cover all aspects of the study experience.

Benefits:

  • Full Tuition Fees: Complete coverage of tuition costs.
  • Travel Allowance: Funds to assist with travel expenses.
  • Living Allowance: Stipend to cover living costs, including housing and daily expenses.
  • Academic Expenses: Coverage for additional academic-related costs, such as books and research materials.

Eligibility:

  • Open to international students applying for Master’s or Ph.D. programs at Stanford University.
  • Applicants must demonstrate exceptional academic achievement and potential.
  • Financial need is considered, and candidates must meet specific admission requirements set by their chosen program.

Application Process:

  • Apply for Admission: Submit your application for admission to a Master’s or Ph.D. program at Stanford University.
  • Complete Financial Aid Forms: Follow the specific instructions for financial aid provided by Stanford, which may include submitting forms such as the Stanford Financial Aid Application and any additional documentation required by your department.
  • Submit Supporting Documents: Provide necessary financial documents and evidence of need, as required by Stanford’s financial aid office.
  • Review and Award: After admission, the financial aid office will review your application and determine your eligibility for the scholarship.
  • Receive Financial Support: If selected, you will be notified of your scholarship award and provided with details about the financial support package.

#3. Yale University Scholarships USA

Yale University in the USA offers several scholarships for both domestic and international students. These scholarships can vary in terms of eligibility, coverage, and application process. Here’s an overview:

1. Yale Need-Based Financial Aid

  • Eligibility: All students, including international students, are eligible to apply.
  • Coverage: The amount is determined based on the financial need of the student. Yale meets 100% of demonstrated financial needs without loans.
  • Application: Students must submit the CSS Profile, and the International Student Financial Aid Application (for international students).

2. Yale Merit-Based Scholarships

  • While Yale does not offer merit-based scholarships directly, some students may receive merit-based awards from external organizations, which can be applied to their Yale education.

3. Yale Fellowships

  • Graduate Students: Yale offers a variety of fellowships for graduate students, particularly in research-based programs. These can cover tuition, stipends, and health insurance.

4. Yale University Scholarships for International Students

  • International students can apply for Yale’s need-based financial aid, and in some cases, specific scholarships offered by Yale or external foundations that work with the university.

5. External Scholarships

  • Yale students often apply for external scholarships offered by private organizations, government agencies, and international organizations. These can help reduce the financial burden.

How to Apply:

  1. For Undergraduate Students:

Complete the CSS Profile, the FAFSA (for U.S. citizens), and any required documentation.

For international students, complete the International Student Financial Aid Application (ISFAA).

  1. For Graduate Students:

Application processes vary by department, but generally involve submitting the FAFSA and/or departmental financial aid forms.

Deadlines:

  • Financial aid deadlines typically align with admission deadlines, so it’s important to check Yale’s official website or contact their financial aid office for specific dates.

#4. University of New Haven Scholarship

The University of New Haven, located in Connecticut, USA, offers several scholarship opportunities for both domestic and international students. These scholarships aim to support students financially based on merit, need, or other criteria. Here’s a breakdown:

1. Merit-Based Scholarships

  • Eligibility: Automatically considered for all incoming undergraduate students based on academic performance (GPA, SAT/ACT scores).
  • Coverage: Amounts typically range from $10,000 to $25,000 per year. These scholarships are renewable for up to four years, provided the student maintains a minimum GPA as specified by the scholarship terms.
  • Application: No separate application is required; students are automatically considered upon admission.

2. Charger Award

  • Eligibility: Awarded to undergraduate students who have shown outstanding academic achievement in high school.
  • Coverage: Varies, but can significantly reduce tuition costs. Renewable for up to four years.
  • Application: Automatically considered during the admissions process.

3. Transfer Scholarships

  • Eligibility: For students transferring from another institution with a strong academic record.
  • Coverage: Awards can range from $12,000 to $20,000 annually.
  • Application: No separate application is required; transfer students are automatically considered.

4. Graduate Scholarships

  • Eligibility: Available to graduate students based on academic merit and program of study.
  • Coverage: Partial tuition scholarships are available, and some programs may offer assistantships that cover tuition and provide a stipend.
  • Application: Some programs automatically consider students, while others may require a separate scholarship application.

5. International Student Scholarships

  • Eligibility: Available to international students with strong academic records.
  • Coverage: Scholarships can range from partial to substantial tuition coverage.
  • Application: Automatically considered upon admission, but international students are encouraged to check specific criteria and deadlines.

6. President’s Scholarship

  • Eligibility: Awarded to the most academically competitive students (based on GPA and standardized test scores).
  • Coverage: This is one of the most prestigious scholarships and can cover a large portion of tuition.
  • Application: Automatic consideration during the admissions process.

How to Apply:

  • Undergraduate Students: Scholarships are generally awarded automatically based on your application for admission, so there is no separate scholarship application needed.
  • Graduate Students: Check specific program requirements for scholarship eligibility and application procedures.

Deadlines:

  • Scholarship consideration deadlines usually align with admission application deadlines, so it’s important to submit all required documents on time.

#5. University of Memphis Scholarships

The University of Memphis offers a variety of scholarships to support both domestic and international students. These scholarships are awarded based on various criteria, including academic merit, financial need, leadership, and other factors. Here’s an overview:

1. Academic Merit Scholarships

  • Eligibility: Awarded to incoming freshmen and transfer students based on high school GPA and standardized test scores (ACT/SAT).
  • Coverage: Scholarships can range from $1,000 to full tuition and fees.
  • Types:
    • Herff Scholarship: For students in the Herff College of Engineering.
    • Emerging Leaders Scholarship: For students with a strong record of leadership in high school.
    • Dean’s Scholarship: For high-achieving students in various academic programs.
  • Application: Some scholarships are automatic upon admission; others may require a separate application.

2. Transfer Scholarships

  • Eligibility: For students transferring from other institutions with a strong academic record.
  • Coverage: Awards range from $3,000 to $7,000 per year.
  • Application: Automatic consideration upon admission; however, students should check for any additional requirements.

3. Need-Based Scholarships

  • Eligibility: Based on demonstrated financial need as determined by the FAFSA (Free Application for Federal Student Aid) for U.S. students.
  • Coverage: Varies depending on the level of financial need.
  • Application: Students must complete the FAFSA to be considered.

4. Departmental Scholarships

  • Eligibility: Many academic departments offer scholarships for students majoring in specific fields.
  • Coverage: Amounts vary by department and scholarship.
  • Application: Check with the specific department for details on how to apply.

5. International Merit Scholarships

  • Eligibility: Available to international undergraduate and graduate students with strong academic records.
  • Coverage: Scholarships typically cover a portion of tuition and fees.
  • Application: Automatic consideration upon admission, but students should verify with the university’s international office.

6. Alumni Association Scholarships

  • Eligibility: Open to both incoming and current students who have a connection to the University of Memphis Alumni Association.
  • Coverage: Varies, but these scholarships can provide significant financial support.
  • Application: Requires a separate application, typically submitted through the Alumni Association.

7. Graduate Assistantships and Fellowships

  • Eligibility: Available to graduate students and often includes a stipend and tuition waiver.
  • Coverage: Full or partial tuition, plus a stipend for living expenses.
  • Application: Students should contact their department for application procedures.

How to Apply:

  • Undergraduate Students: Many scholarships are automatically considered during the admissions process, but some may require separate applications or additional documentation.
  • Graduate Students: Contact the specific department or program for details on available scholarships, assistantships, and fellowships.

Deadlines:

  • Freshman Scholarships: Priority deadlines usually fall around December 1 for the following academic year.
  • Transfer Scholarships: Deadlines vary, but early application is encouraged.
  • Departmental Scholarships: Deadlines are typically specific to each department.

#6. The University of Minnesota Fellowship

The University of Minnesota offers a variety of fellowships, particularly for graduate students, aimed at supporting advanced study and research. These fellowships are designed to attract and support top-tier students, offering financial assistance, academic recognition, and professional development opportunities. Here’s an overview of the fellowship opportunities:

1. Graduate School Fellowships

  • Diversity of Views and Experiences (DOVE) Fellowship:
    • Eligibility: For incoming graduate students from underrepresented backgrounds in graduate education.
    • Coverage: Provides a stipend, tuition, and health insurance for one academic year.
    • Application: Students are nominated by their department as part of the graduate application process.
  • Doctoral Dissertation Fellowship (DDF):
    • Eligibility: For advanced doctoral students who are in the final stages of their dissertation.
    • Coverage: A stipend, tuition for thesis credits, and health insurance for one year.
    • Application: Nominated by their department, typically in the spring semester.

2. Department-Specific Fellowships

  • Eligibility: Varies by department; these fellowships are often based on academic merit, research potential, and fit with the department’s focus areas.
  • Coverage: This can include full or partial tuition waivers, stipends, and sometimes additional funds for research or travel.
  • Application: Students are typically considered during the admissions process, but some fellowships may require a separate application.

3. External Fellowships Administered by the University

  • NSF Graduate Research Fellowship:
    • Eligibility: Open to U.S. citizens, nationals, and permanent residents pursuing research-based master’s and doctoral degrees in STEM or social sciences.
    • Coverage: Includes a stipend and an allowance for tuition and fees for up to three years.
    • Application: Students apply directly through the NSF, but university resources are available to assist with the application.

4. Interdisciplinary Doctoral Fellowship (IDF)

  • Eligibility: For doctoral students who wish to pursue interdisciplinary research projects and be hosted by one of the university’s interdisciplinary research centers or institutes.
  • Coverage: Provides a stipend, tuition for thesis credits, and health insurance for one year.
  • Application: Students must submit a proposal that includes endorsement by both their home department and the interdisciplinary center.

5. Provost’s Professional Education Diversity Fellowship

  • Eligibility: Designed to support professional graduate students (e.g., law, medicine, public health) who bring diverse perspectives to their programs.
  • Coverage: Includes a stipend, tuition waiver, and health insurance.
  • Application: Students are usually nominated by their department or professional school.

6. Postdoctoral Fellowships

  • Eligibility: For scholars who have recently completed their Ph.D. and wish to conduct further research.
  • Coverage: Stipend, research funds, and sometimes housing or travel allowances.
  • Application: Typically involves a research proposal, letters of recommendation, and collaboration with a university faculty member.

How to Apply:

  • Graduate Fellowships: Most fellowships require departmental nomination, so students should communicate their interest in fellowships early in the application process.
  • External Fellowships: Students apply directly to the funding organization but can seek support from university resources.
  • Deadlines: Varies by fellowship. Departmental fellowships often align with graduate application deadlines, while other fellowships have specific deadlines, often in the fall or spring.

Resources for Fellowship Applications:

  • The University of Minnesota Graduate School offers resources and guidance on how to apply for these fellowships.
  • Students are encouraged to work closely with their academic advisors and department administrators to ensure they meet all eligibility requirements and deadlines.

#7. AAUW International Fellowship Program

The AAUW (American Association of University Women) International Fellowship Program is designed to support women from around the world who are pursuing full-time graduate or postgraduate study in the United States. Established in 1917, the fellowship program is one of AAUW’s oldest and most prestigious, aimed at empowering women through education.

Key Features of the AAUW International Fellowship Program:

1. Eligibility:

  • Gender: Open to women only.
  • Citizenship: Applicants must be citizens of a country other than the United States.
  • Academic Level: The fellowship supports full-time study at accredited U.S. institutions for master’s, doctoral, or postdoctoral degrees.
  • Educational Background: Applicants must have earned the equivalent of a U.S. bachelor’s degree by the application deadline.
  • Academic Commitment: The program is intended for women who plan to return to their home countries after completing their studies to contribute to the advancement of women and girls through their chosen fields.

2. Fellowship Coverage:

  • Master’s/Professional Fellowship: $20,000
  • Doctoral Fellowship: $25,000
  • Postdoctoral Fellowship: $50,000
  • Funding Use: The fellowship funds can be used for tuition, living expenses, dependent child care, travel to professional meetings, and educational materials.

3. Application Process:

  • Online Application: Candidates must apply online through the AAUW’s official portal.
  • Supporting Documents: The application requires several documents, including academic transcripts, proof of degree, a detailed budget, a personal statement, and recommendations.
  • Deadline: The application typically opens in August and closes in mid-November each year.
  • Selection Criteria: Applications are judged on academic excellence, proposed plan of study, commitment to the advancement of women and girls, and the applicant’s leadership potential.

4. Additional Opportunities:

  • Renewal: The fellowship is not renewable, but recipients may reapply for the program each year.
  • Special Awards: Recipients are eligible to apply for additional AAUW funding for community projects that promote education and equity for women and girls.

Purpose and Impact:

  • The AAUW International Fellowship aims to foster global understanding and cooperation, encouraging women to return to their home countries and implement the knowledge and skills acquired in the U.S. to contribute to the development of their communities and nations.

How to Apply:

  • Visit the AAUW International Fellowships page for detailed information on application requirements, and deadlines, and to access the application portal.
  • It’s recommended to start preparing early, as the process is competitive and requires a well-documented application.

The AAUW International Fellowship is a significant opportunity for women who are dedicated to advancing their education and using their skills to make a difference in their home countries.

#8. ACI Foundation Scholarship

The ACI Foundation Scholarship is a prestigious program offered by the ACI Foundation, an affiliate of the American Concrete Institute (ACI). These scholarships are aimed at students pursuing careers in fields related to concrete, materials science, engineering, and construction. The scholarships are designed to support undergraduate and graduate students who demonstrate academic excellence and a strong interest in the concrete industry.

Key Features of the ACI Foundation Scholarship:

Types of Scholarships:

The ACI Foundation offers several scholarships, each with its own specific eligibility requirements and focus areas:

– ACI Foundation Fellowship: Typically for graduate students pursuing research in concrete-related fields.

– ACI Foundation Scholarships: Available for both undergraduate and graduate students. Some specific scholarships include:

     – Richard D. Stehly Memorial Scholarship

– Concrete Construction Management Scholarship

     – Graduate Scholarships (various, focused on specific research areas within concrete and materials science)

Eligibility:

   – Academic Standing: Applicants must be full-time students in their sophomore year or higher for undergraduate scholarships, or enrolled in a graduate program.

   – Field of Study: Must be pursuing a degree in civil engineering, structural engineering, architecture, construction management, or a related field with a focus on concrete.

   – Membership: While ACI membership is not required, it may be advantageous.

Scholarship Coverage:

   – Amount: Awards vary depending on the specific scholarship, generally ranging from $5,000 to $15,000.

   – Additional Benefits: Some scholarships include additional opportunities such as a paid internship, mentoring by an industry professional, and networking opportunities through ACI events.

Application Process:

   – Online Application: Candidates must apply through the ACI Foundation’s online application system.

– Required Documents: The application typically requires academic transcripts, a resume or CV, letters of recommendation, a personal statement outlining career goals, and proof of enrollment.

– Deadline: Applications usually open in the summer and close around November each year.

Selection Criteria:

– Academic Excellence: Strong academic performance in relevant coursework.

– Leadership and Involvement: Active participation in extracurricular activities, especially those related to concrete, construction, and engineering.

   – Professional Goals: A demonstrated commitment to a career in the concrete industry or a related field.

How to Apply:

– Visit the [ACI Foundation Scholarships page](https://www.acifoundation.org/scholarships.aspx) for detailed information on each scholarship, eligibility criteria, and access to the application portal.

– Ensure that all required documents are submitted by the deadline to be considered.

Additional Opportunities:

– ACI Foundation Fellowships: In addition to scholarships, the ACI Foundation offers fellowships that include financial support, mentorship, and the opportunity to attend ACI conventions.

– Internship Opportunities: Some scholarships offer paid internships that provide hands-on experience in the concrete industry.

Benefits of the ACI Foundation Scholarship:

– Financial Support: The scholarship can significantly reduce the financial burden of higher education.

– Professional Development: Recipients gain access to industry events, networking opportunities, and mentorship, which can be invaluable for career development.

– Recognition: Being an ACI Foundation Scholar is a prestigious accolade that is highly regarded in the concrete and construction industries.

The ACI Foundation Scholarship is an excellent opportunity for students who are passionate about concrete and construction to advance their education and career prospects.

#9. Onsi Sawiris Scholarship

The Onsi Sawiris Scholarship Program is a highly prestigious scholarship offered by Orascom Construction, a leading Egyptian engineering and construction company. The program is designed to support exceptional Egyptian students in pursuing undergraduate and graduate studies at top universities in the United States. The scholarship focuses on fields that are crucial to Egypt’s development, such as engineering, business administration, economics, and finance.

Key Features of the Onsi Sawiris Scholarship Program:

1. Eligibility:

  • Citizenship: Applicants must be Egyptian nationals residing in Egypt.
  • Academic Achievement:
    • For undergraduate scholarships: High academic achievement in high school.
    • For graduate scholarships: A strong academic record in undergraduate studies.
  • Fields of Study: The scholarship is typically awarded for studies in engineering, economics, business administration, or finance.
  • University Admission: Applicants must have applied and been accepted to a top U.S. university for the relevant program.
  • Leadership and Extracurricular: Demonstrated leadership skills and involvement in extracurricular activities are highly valued.

2. Scholarship Coverage:

  • Tuition: Full tuition coverage at the recipient’s chosen U.S. university.
  • Living Expenses: Includes a generous stipend for living expenses.
  • Travel: Coverage of travel expenses to and from the United States.
  • Health Insurance: Full coverage of health insurance while studying in the U.S.

3. Application Process:

  • Online Application: Applications are submitted through the official scholarship portal.
  • Required Documents: Typically includes academic transcripts, standardized test scores (e.g., SAT, GRE, GMAT), proof of admission to a U.S. university, a resume, letters of recommendation, and a personal statement.
  • Interview: Shortlisted candidates are invited to an interview as part of the selection process.
  • Deadline: The application process generally begins in the fall, with deadlines usually around December or January.

4. Selection Criteria:

  • Academic Excellence: Strong academic performance in relevant subjects.
  • Leadership Potential: Demonstrated leadership skills and a commitment to contributing to the community and Egypt’s development.
  • Career Aspirations: Applicants must express a clear plan for how their studies will contribute to their career goals and the development of Egypt.

5. Commitment to Egypt:

  • Return Requirement: Recipients are required to return to Egypt for a period after completing their studies in the U.S., where they are expected to contribute to the country’s development in their field of expertise.

How to Apply:

  • Visit the Onsi Sawiris Scholarship Program page for detailed eligibility information, and required documents, and to access the application portal.
  • Ensure that all required documents are prepared and submitted by the deadline to be considered for the scholarship.

Benefits of the Onsi Sawiris Scholarship:

  • World-Class Education: The scholarship provides access to top-tier universities in the United States, offering world-class education and research opportunities.
  • Comprehensive Support: With full coverage of tuition, living expenses, travel, and health insurance, the scholarship allows recipients to focus fully on their studies.
  • Professional Development: Scholars gain access to valuable networks and professional opportunities, both in the U.S. and upon their return to Egypt.
  • Commitment to Development: The scholarship emphasizes the importance of contributing to Egypt’s development, aligning with the goals of many aspiring leaders.

The Onsi Sawiris Scholarship Program is an outstanding opportunity for Egyptian students who aspire to study in the U.S. and make a significant impact on their home country.

#10. Rotary Peace Fellowship Program

The Rotary Peace Fellowship Program is a prestigious and fully-funded fellowship designed to develop global leaders who are committed to peace and conflict resolution. The program is offered by Rotary International and is available to individuals from around the world who wish to pursue a master’s degree or a professional development certificate in fields related to peace, conflict prevention, and resolution.

Key Features of the Rotary Peace Fellowship Program:

1. Program Tracks:

  • Master’s Degree Program:
    • Duration: 15 to 24 months, including a practical internship of 2 to 3 months.
    • Fields of Study: Fellows study at one of Rotary’s partner universities, pursuing degrees in international relations, public administration, sustainable development, peace studies, or a related field.
    • Locations: Partner universities include institutions in the United States, Japan, the United Kingdom, Sweden, Australia, and Thailand.
  • Professional Development Certificate Program:
    • Duration: A 3-month intensive program designed for mid-career professionals.
    • Focus: Provides practical training in peacebuilding, conflict resolution, and mediation.
    • Location: Conducted at Chulalongkorn University in Bangkok, Thailand.

2. Eligibility:

  • Professional Experience:
    • For the Master’s program: At least 3 years of relevant work experience in peace and development.
    • For the Certificate program: At least 5 years of relevant work experience.
  • Academic Background: Strong academic background relevant to the chosen field of study.
  • Language Proficiency: Proficiency in English is required, and proficiency in a second language is desirable.
  • Commitment to Peace: Demonstrated commitment to peace and conflict resolution through professional or volunteer experience.

3. Fellowship Coverage:

  • Tuition and Fees: Full coverage of tuition and related academic fees.
  • Living Expenses: Stipend to cover room and board, including housing and meals.
  • Travel Expenses: Round-trip transportation to and from the fellowship site.
  • Internship/Field Study: Funds for a practical internship or field study related to peace and conflict resolution.
  • Health Insurance: Full coverage for the duration of the fellowship.

4. Application Process:

  • Online Application: Applications must be submitted through the Rotary International website.
  • Supporting Documents: The application requires academic transcripts, a resume, letters of recommendation, a personal statement, and a plan of study or professional development goals.
  • Interview: Shortlisted candidates are invited for an interview as part of the selection process.
  • Deadline: The application process usually begins in February and closes in May each year, with the fellowship starting the following academic year.

5. Selection Criteria:

  • Leadership Potential: Strong leadership skills and a commitment to community service.
  • Commitment to Peace: A demonstrated track record of working on peace-related issues.
  • Academic and Professional Qualifications: Strong academic background and relevant professional experience.
  • Impact Potential: A clear vision for how the fellowship will help advance peace in the candidate’s home country or globally.

6. Partner Universities:

  • Master’s Programs:
    • Duke University and the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, USA
    • International Christian University, Japan
    • University of Bradford, UK
    • University of Queensland, Australia
    • Uppsala University, Sweden
  • Professional Development Certificate:
    • Chulalongkorn University, Thailand

How to Apply:

  • Visit the Rotary Peace Fellowship page for detailed eligibility information, and required documents, and to access the application portal.
  • Ensure that all required documents are prepared and submitted by the deadline to be considered for the fellowship.

Benefits of the Rotary Peace Fellowship:

  • Global Network: Fellows join a global community of peacebuilders and gain access to Rotary’s extensive network of professionals and alumni.
  • Comprehensive Support: The fellowship covers all major expenses, allowing fellows to focus on their studies and practical training.
  • Professional Growth: The program provides robust training and practical experience, preparing fellows for leadership roles in peace and conflict resolution.
  • Lasting Impact: Graduates of the program are expected to make significant contributions to peacebuilding efforts worldwide, often returning to their home countries to lead initiatives and influence policy.

The Rotary Peace Fellowship Program is an exceptional opportunity for individuals dedicated to advancing peace and conflict resolution on a global scale.
